pullRequest.body:
Notable changes: lemmas were added in https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/538 about `gcd` and `lcm`, that now have implicit arguments. Mostly this is a positive change in Mathlib, we can just delete the arguments. The one to consider in review is in [`ModEq`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9828/files#diff-bf7908935cfca2e7d7959ec20d701fcda99586d0b7620b05b0a803988fdbd4fc).

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: What was the rationale for making the arguments implicit in leanprover/std4#538?

> What was the rationale for making the arguments implicit in [leanprover/std4#538](https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/538)?

No rationale, it was done without reference to what mathlib was doing. i.e. I wrote them from scratch and took advantage of autoImplicit. :-) I'm happy to switch back if there is a reason to.

I do want a quick resolution on this PR, because I can't update `bump/v4.6.0` until Mathlib `master` is using the HEAD of Std's `main` again, and this will cause problems the longer it is delayed.

Thus if you, or any maintainer, says "the change to implicit argument is bad", then I will promise to change them back, but not here.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7577745057/job/20639128908)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7577745057/job/20639128199)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7577745057/job/20639128574)
